description.narrative: In this inception phase, Swedish Radio Media Development Organisation (SR-MDO) and Rwanda Broadcasting Agency (RBA) have planed for a new cooperation phase of four years 2019-2023. The planning was based on necessary steps to go through to develop a four year project. The deliverables were: 1) A project document including steps as training in RBM, gender, environment and conflict analysis. 2) Putting a project organization in place. 3) A communication plan for internal anchoring of the the strategy and Public Service broadcasting. 4) Moving forward in selected strategy areas to facilitate future implementation; sustainability; content and audience; innovation and technology. 5) The Digitalization of the RBA archives has reached the next level for the digitizing factory to be put in place.

Sedan 2014 arbetar Sveriges Radio Media Development Organisation (SR MDO) tillsammans med Rwanda Broadcasting Authority (RBA) för att förbättra RBA's möjligheter att leverera på sitt uppdrag att vara en public service institution i enlighet med mediereformerna som antogs i Rwanda 2013.
SR MDO har under det senaste projektet som löper 2016-2018 utbildat journalister och redaktiononschefer i metoder för putblic service journalistik, stöttat regionala radionstationer att utveckla försäljningsplaner samt stöttat RBA's styrelse i att ta fram en femårig strategisk plan för organisationen.
Under den föreslagna förberedande fasen (inception phase) förväntas SR MDO och RBA utveckla ett programförslag som bygger på att förankra och implementera den strategiska planen liksom att påbörja vissa studier som t ex kring finansieringsmodeller för public service.
Den förberedande fasens budget är på 2 950 000 kr. Den svenska ambassaden i Kigali beslutar om stöd som omfattar hela det ansökta beloppet.

Since 2014, Swedish Radio Media Development Organisation (SR MDO) are working in partnership with Rwanda Broadcasting Authority (RBA) to improve RBA's possibilities to deliver on its mandate as an public service broadcaster according to the media reforms decided upon 2013.
SR MDO has during the latest project, running 2016-2018, been training journalists and editors in public service broadcasting methods, supporting the development of regional marketplans and togheter with RBA's board, developed a five year strategy for the authority.
During the proposed inception phase SR MDO and RBA plan to develop a program proposal based on the strategic plan but also to carry out some studies regarding e.g. possible financial models for public service in Rwanda.
The budget for the inception phase is 2 950 000 SEK. The Swedish Embassy in Kigali plan to finance the entire budget.

description.narrative: A selection of results are that RBA management has achieved basic knowledge of Results Based Management methodology, including gender mainstreaming, environment/climate assessment and conflict perspective. The digitalization of the RBA archives has reached the next level for the digitizing factory (a big scale digitalizaton with the ambition to digitalize all programmes/contents) to be put in place, meaning that more programmes has been digitalized and a better structure of the archives are in place as well as a procurement process has started for tools and capacity to do the big scale work. RBA and SR MDO have used the technique "peer-to-peer assessments" within some of the strategic areas which have helped bringing clarity to some of the more complex challenges, such as finding a sustainable financing model to safeguard RBA's independence or making all RBA content accessible on all media platforms, where none are quick fix achievements. The Embassy assess that these peer-to-peer assessments have provided valuable input to the elaboration of the new project period (2019-2023) and offered direction for decision making and implementation of RBA´s strategic goals. After the launch of the RBA strategic plan in May 2018, there was a strategic momentum for the internal communication process of the plan within the RBA organization. During that period the strategic plan and public service broadcasting values where disseminated throughout the organisation. Communication can be improved within and between project activities, to ensure that everyone involved or affected is properly informed, which will avoid delays and misunderstandings. The Embassy agrees with SR MDO that a future project should produce a more detailed communication plan ahead of each project implementation. To conclude, the main focus of the inception phase has been achieved which was to get the project documents for SR-MDO's next proposed phase in place and to establish a solid project organization that cut across the respective organizations.
